contentfulPagePressRelease.title: Sidra Holds Recruitment Open Day for Nationals

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Sidra Medical and Research Center (Sidra) received over 2,300 applications as a result of its National Recruitment Open Day on 13 August 2017. The event targeted more than 100 entry level and mid-level medical administration careers at Sidra for Qataris and those with Qatari mothers.

Dr. Kholode Al Obaidli, Chief Learning Officer at Sidra said, “Our recruitment open day was a huge success with over 1,300 visitors in a span of 12 hours! I was very pleased to see the growing interest that our young Qataris have in joining the healthcare sector. The enthusiasm, curiosity and eagerness displayed by the visitors, makes me really proud to work for an organization like Sidra that continues to attract talent amongst the community and abroad. I would like to thank the young applicants and their families who took the time to come see us and ask questions about potential careers at Sidra. I hope we were able to showcase the investment that we are making in the future of our nationals and the measures we are putting in place to become an employer of choice.”

The open day also featured a signing ceremony between Chief Executive Officer, Peter Morris, Chief Learning Officer, Dr. Kholode Al Obaidli from Sidra and Dr. Abdallah Hazaimeh, the Dean of the Community College of Qatar (CCQ).
Sidra has partnered with CCQ to offer a customised four month “Healthcare Office Skills” program. Candidates who are selected for some of the medical administration roles, will embark on the program immediately after joining the organization. It includes courses such as medical office administration, medical terminology for healthcare, health information management systems, and business computer applications.

“We are now in the process of reviewing all the applications we received online and in-person. Our team will reach out to candidates whose applications have been successful for a first round of interviews. Due to the large volume of applications, candidates can expect to hear from us within the next four weeks. High School graduate applicants for the Unit Clerk vacancy who meet the job criteria will be invited to undertake a language exam and if successful, offered the opportunity to be part of our training program,” said Dr. Kholode.

Sidra has advertised for administration-based roles across the organization in sections such as the various clinical management groups, finance, radiology, patient experience. For inquiries related to working at Sidra, please visit careers.sidra.org.
